EKP:n pääjohtajan Mario Draghin puhe Helsingin yliopistossa http://t.co/fhLPES9EGC (FI)
@beschuit_p Correct to a large extent. Draghi addresses this issue in his speech
Draghi: All this could only take place in the context of a decisive step towards closer Fiscal Union
Draghi: Would be natural over longer term to reflect further on how to always preserve ability to use fiscal policy counter-cyclically
Draghi: But no form of stronger governance can entirely remove the risk of self-fulfilling liquidity crises
Draghi: I welcome the Commission’s new proposal to stimulate investment spending in Europe
Draghi: Sound fiscal policy framework is necessary but it is not sufficient
Draghi: The importance of each country sticking to its commitments under the Stability and Growth Pact should therefore be beyond debate
Draghi: Sovereign debt must act as safe haven in times of econ. stress by a strong fiscal governance framework and by some form of backstop
Draghi: It is essential that national fiscal policies can perform their macroeconomic stabilisation role alongside monetary policy
Draghi: If we do not want a transfer union, then we have to be consistent and establish an environment where other mechanisms can work
Draghi: If we are to deepen private sector risk-sharing, we urgently need to address the barriers to capital market integration
Draghi: We need other ways to help spread short term costs. There is a particular onus on private risk-sharing to play this role.
Draghi: There is strong case for sovereignty over relevant econ. policies to be exercised jointly. That means above all structural reforms.
Draghi: During the crisis countries with more flexible economies have on the whole adjusted faster and with a lower employment cost
Draghi: Euro area countries need to invest more in other mechanisms to share the cost of shocks
Draghi: All euro area countries need to be able to thrive independently
Draghi: Euro is – and has to be – irrevocable in all Member States, not just b/o of Treaties, otherwise there cannot be a truly single money
Draghi: If there are parts of the euro area worse off inside the Union, doubts may grow about whether they might ultimately have to leave
Draghi: Member States have to be better off inside the union than they would be outside
Draghi: It is clear that, for all its resilience, our union is still incomplete
Draghi: If our union has proved more resilient than many thought, it is because those who doubted it misjudged the political dimension
Speech Mario Draghi:  Stability and Prosperity in Monetary Union http://t.co/ruMNdOliYS

Speech by ECB vice-president Vítor Constâncio at the FT's Banking Summit. http://t.co/pG3Jyqkko8
Constâncio: see a need to broaden scope of the existing macro-prudential policy toolkit in general and broaden ECB's toolkit in particular.
Constâncio: Argument that sovereign bond purchases, if necessary, would ease the pressure on governments to do structural reforms not valid.
Constâncio: SSM creates conditions and incentives for deeper integration of the European banking market, making euro area less vulnerable.
Vice-president Vítor Constâncio speaking at FT's Banking Summit in London.

Draghi: We will do what we must to raise inflation and inflation expectations as fast as possible
Draghi: Monetary policy will do its part; other policies must assist, or at least not counteract
Draghi: It is essential to bring back inflation to target and without delay
Draghi: If needed, we would recalibrate the size, pace and composition of our purchases as necessary to deliver our mandate
Draghi: ECB is in the ‘third contingency’ I outlined in Amsterdam speech (see http://t.co/L41jdnbtJn)
Draghi: Underlying demand weakness is also playing a role in low core inflation
Draghi: Inflation situation in euro area has become increasingly challenging
Draghi: Economic situation remains difficult; stronger recovery unlikely in coming months
Draghi: Governments and the ECB have taken steps to address fragmentation of financial system

Draghi: We will not formally participate in a national parliaments' inquiry; we have not decided on any informal participation
Draghi: Fourteen euro area countries show positive growth, two countries are in recession and two in stagnation
Draghi: Default rates on ABS in US 18.5%, in Europe 1.5%. And we will only buy very specific ABS, which have even lower default rates
Draghi: There is no strong correlation between governments' inaction and low interest rates.
Draghi: Whether you like banks or not, they intermediate 80% of credit
Draghi: Our monetary policy has been extraordinarily successful in reducing interest rates, even without QE.
Draghi: The ECB has not been created to make sure governments do the right thing
